alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County; Southwestern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 2:56PM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED DURING THE CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY... .A series of cold upper level storm systems lowered snow levels to around 500 to 1000 feet early this morning. Snow levels have risen to 1500 feet this afternoon but will likely fall again to below 500 feet early Monday. Periods of heavy showers spreading across the cold airmass will favor significant mountain snowfall lasting through Monday morning. A dusting of snow is possible down to sea level. Travel across mountain roadways and highway passes will subsequently be difficult if not impossible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Portions of northwest California. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
